definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: It was a confirmation that the Nazis are still there and still active.
sentences.chinese: 這證實了納粹黨仍然存在着，並活動着。

sentences.english: She told him people wanted to forget the Nazis.
sentences.chinese: 她對丈夫說，人們都想忘記納粹黨人。

sentences.english: His house in Berlin was ransacked by the Nazis.
sentences.chinese: 他在柏林的住宅曾遭納粹黨人洗劫。

sentences.english: As nazism took hold of Germany, however, he saw nazism for what it was.
sentences.chinese: 但當納粹黨在德國當政後，他看清了納粹的真面目。

sentences.english: And that was one of the reasons for the success of the Nazis , of Hitler.
sentences.chinese: 那還是納粹黨人取得成功的一個原因。

sentences.english: What, he wanted to know, was a good Nazi?
sentences.chinese: 他渴望知曉，何謂優秀的納粹黨人？

sentences.english: What is the difference between a Nazi and adog?
sentences.chinese: 納粹黨人和狗的卻別是什麼？

sentences.english: And I said, OK, it's a Nazi, there's no doubt in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 然後我說，好吧，是納粹黨，我毫不懷疑。

sentences.english: By 1933, the Nazi party had risen to power in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 到1933年，法西斯納粹黨已經在德國上臺執政。

sentences.english: Investigators found drawings of swastikas and graffiti at the scene.
sentences.chinese: 調查人員發現納粹黨萬字符號和一些亂劃的痕跡。

sentences.english: The neck of the bottle has a smaller label of an eagle on top of a swastika.
sentences.chinese: 瓶頸上有一個更小的標籤，上面有帶鷹的納粹黨徽。

definition: General Douglas MacArthur (1880-1964), US commander in Pacific during WW2, sacked in 1951 by President Truman for exceeding orders during the Korean war
amphibious/dual-talented/able to work in two different lines
Marshal Josip Broz Tito (1892-1980), Yugoslav military and communist political leader, president of Yugoslavia 1945-1980
38th parallel, forming the DMZ border between North and South Korea
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Hundred Days Reform (1898), failed attempt to reform the Qing dynasty
Jobs (name)/see also 史提夫·賈伯斯|史提夫·贾伯斯[Shi3 ti2 fu1 · Jia3 bo2 si1], Steve Jobs

(neologism c. 2013) organized disruption of healthcare facilities or verbal and physical abuse of medical staff, by an aggrieved patient or proxies such as family members or hired thugs, typically aimed at obtaining compensation
